info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 10 at 5:16PM EDT until July 10 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City NC
info.description:
At 516 PM EDT, emergency management reported flash flooding, especially over northern Roanoke Island. Flooding has also been reported in Manns Harbor and Nags Head. Thunderstorms producing heavy rain will continue across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Emergency management reported.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kill Devil Hills, Nags Head, Manns Harbor, Manteo, Whalebone, Roanoke Island Festival Park, Jockeys Ridge State Park, Nags Head Fishing Pier and Wright Brothers National Monument.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTH CENTRAL DARE COUNTY
